commitResults.messageTitle: added markDone() and markUnDone() in Task.java
Added todo, deadline, event as subclasses
Finished event, todo, deadline time detection
Added input.txt, ACTUAL.txt, EXPECTED.txt; Add PAUSE to runtest.bat
put all the files in packages, set up unit testing

commitResults.messageBody: Add generateTaskList(), fetchTask() in DukeEngine.java, add exception handlers in Duke.java

The engine now recognises deadline and event time as dates instead of strings.
Can use "search 01/03/2020" to search events due/happening at the date.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixed issues about Dates and Times
commitResults.messageBody:
Successfully implemented dates and times function in Dukes,
making it compatible with the save function.
Merge add-gradle-support branch into the main project, set up gradle to run tasks
Refactor the code to extract classes UI, Storage, Parser, TaskList, Command and its subclasses.
Organise the code into packages dukes.engine, dukes.command, dukes.task and dukes.util
Set up Gradle to run JUnit tests, add tests for DeadLine.java, ToDo.java and Parser.java
Allows user to search tasklist by keyword and find the respective tasks

Add JavaDoc comments for all classes and non-private methods,
except for getter and setter methods.
Adjust the code to comply with the coding standard.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Find feature, JavaDoc headers and coding standard
commitResults.messageBody: Adjust the merge and makes the duke software combine the 3 features of find, javadoc and coding standard

commitResults.messageTitle: Learn about basic UI for Duke
Add a GUI to Duke through JavaFX
commitResults.messageBody: Using JavaFX and FXML to add a GUI to Duke, that allows user to directly input command and get response. Add Main, MainWindow and Launcher in dukes.engine

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc to the new files
commitResults.messageBody: Add JavaDoc as method headers to the methods in MainWindow, Main, Launcher and new methods in Command family
Set up checkstyle for the coding using Gradle

commitResults.messageTitle: Command classes : Refactor and clean some part of the code
commitResults.messageBody:
Command class and its subclasses have some deprecated methods, such as
execute(), which is no longer used. This causes code redundancy.

This commit removes these codes.

The subclasses of Command also contain some long methods over 30 lines.
This reduces code readability and code quality.

For the duplicate code that is used in multiple subclasses, this commit
extracts them into public static methods in the superclass to be used in
 the subclasses, so as to reduce redundancy.

For the non-duplicate long methods within the subclasses, this commit
extracts them into private util methods in the subclasses. This
conforms to the OOP principle, and increases readability.

At the same time, this commit creates a new jar file, duke.jar, in
build/libs. The mainClassName in build.gradle is updated to be
“dukes.engine.Launcher”.
